title: Antiquarian Society
copy: Today’s Antiquarian Society (renamed in 1894) was founded in 1877, as the Chicago Society of Decorative Arts. At the invitation of Charles L. Hutchinson, the first president of the Art Institute of Chicago, our founding members became a significant force in the creation of the Art Institute’s early collection. Throughout its 144-year history, The Antiquarian Society proudly continues its legacy and tradition of gifting significant acquisitions for the departments of Applied Arts of Europe and Arts of the Americas, while also fostering and promoting educational activities in the decorative arts for its members.   A Selection of Acquisitions Supported by the Antiquarian Society
